body.p: allows you configure the colors for frames, dialog boxes, controls, and commands. To configure the Colors, and go to Appearance Colors .

Clicking the color button for any of the options opens a Choose color dialog box. It includes several tabs that allow you to configure the color in numerous ways. This page allows you to select and configure the color for the following:
Background - Background color for various general user interface items.
Text components background - Background color for various components (such as text fields, views, and dialog boxes).
Menus and toolbars backround - Background color for specific components such as menus, toolbars, and tabs.
Selection background - Background color for the current selections in certain components, such as some views and panes.
Inactive selection background - Background color for a selection in a view that is not the current focus.
Menus and toolbars selection background - (This option is not available for Mac OS) Background color for menu selections and toolbar buttons.
View titles background - Background color for the titles of view and tabs.
Foreground - Foreground color for various general user interface items.
Disabled foreground - Foreground color for various components that are not the current focus (such as views other than the currently selected one).
Selection foreground - Foreground color for the current selection.
Link foreground - Foreground color for links in views and dialog boxes.
Borders and table grids - Color for certain borders and table grid lines.
Separator - Color for the separators in toolbars, menus, and dialog boxes.
body.note: You must restart the application for your changes to be applied.
